featured.text: Then we could relax and have a drink.

Laughter, too, has a beneficial effect on our immune system, (38) the production of white blood cells and increasing our resistance to infection.(39) makes a difference to our appearance, too, when we relax our facial muscles!

That is why some of the most successful companies in the world, such as 3M and Google, encourage their employees to 18 all sorts of relaxing activities, such as playing pinball and wandering about the campus.
They needed time to relax when smelling something unfamiliar.

When the elephants detected the smell of clothing worn by a Maasai man, they moved away from the smell faster and took longer to relax than when they detected the smells of either clothing worn by Kamba men or clothing that had not been worn at all.

definition.zh_def: 放鬆，減輕壓力或緊張的狀態。
definition.en_def: To make or become less tense or anxious; to rest or take it easy.
definition.example: After a long week of work, I like to relax by reading a book.
